toggle.heading: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: National Liberal Arts Colleges
hero.description: The National Liberal Arts Colleges, including schools like Colby College and Wesleyan University, emphasize undergraduate education and award at least half of their degrees in the liberal arts fields of study.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

items.blurb: Founded in 1856, Albright College is a private institution. Albright College follows a 4-1-4-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

items.blurb: Founded in 1870, Allen University is a private institution.
Founded in 1886, Aquinas College is a private institution.
Founded in 2003, Ave Maria University is a private institution. Ave Maria University follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

items.blurb: Founded in 1873, Bennett College is a private institution.
Founded in 1840, Bethany College (WV) is a private institution.
Founded in 1927, Bethany Lutheran College is a private institution. Bethany Lutheran College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

Founded in 1904, Bethune-Cookman University is a private institution. The school has 55.3% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Bethune-Cookman University is 14:1.
Founded in 1837, Blackburn College is a private institution.

items.blurb: Founded in 1868, Bloomfield College is a private institution. Bloomfield College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered less selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: The most popular fields of study for international students in the U.S. are business and management and engineering.
